title: Threading!  (Yes again!)
content:
I want to add my voice to the myriad complaints that have already been posted about the way Thunderbird has started threading messages!

I loathe threading!

Like many others, I do not understand why there is not a simple menu option, or something in the settings, that lets me turn OFF threading, permanently, in every folder of every account.

There are so many complaints about this that I just had to stop reading them after half an hour. I agree with most of them, so I won't reiterate every single point. I couldn't see any poster defending threading, and I couldn't see anything from a developer explaining why this is forced on users. Is it simply a matter of the developers themselves liking it, and not caring what the user base thinks? I respect the developers. I respect Linus Torvalds too, but I don't hesitate to call him out when he says something really dumb, which he does depressingly often. Being a developer gives you the right to control a product, but it does not make you right.

I am a monthly financial contributor to Thunderbird. I have used it for many years. But this is a deal-breaker for me. If a solution to this problem isn't forthcoming, *soon*, I will abandon ship. The withdrawal of my small monthly financial support won't hurt the team. I only mention it to establish that I have been a committed Thunderbird user who demonstrates that commitment in practical terms.
creator: mozilla411

title: Thunderbird Email v115.11.0 broke Multi-Instance Sessions (ie more than one version running)
content:
Thunderbird Portable v115.9.0 may be the last working version that allowed multiple sessions and versions to run at the same time. I tested it and it worked.

Thunderbird Email v115.11.0 is definitely broke for Multi-Instance Sessions. I tested it and it does not work.

So perhaps somewhere between v115.10.0 and v115.10.2 Multi-Instance functionality was broken on the portable version of the Thunderbird Email App.

title: 2-1/2 years of emails disappeared from Inbox
content:
I am running Thunderbird ver 128.1.1esr (32-bit) on a WIndows 10 PC. Yesterday I noticed that emails from mid-December 2021 thru August 24, 2024 from my main email address Inbox had gone missing. Emails from noon on August 25, 2024 thru today are present.

I have about 80 sub or subsub-folders to the Inbox where I sort some of the emails mostly by filters but also some manually. As far as I have noticed, none of the emails in the subfolders are missing. The Inbox (with emails from 1/1/20 thru 12/10/21) shows about 3,200 emails (this excludes those in the subfolders). My guess is that about 7,000 emails might be missing.

The missing emails were not in any Trash or other folders, or in the recycle bin.

The Trash folder for the Inbox has about 1,300 emails going back to March 2024 - all of which I had deleted

I have Inboxes from 4 other email addresses operating in Thunderbird, and none of those have been affected

I do a complete backup of my hard drive every night, so if there is a file that would have the missing emails, I should be able to recover them 

     1) Any ideas why the emails disappeared. 
     2) What steps can I take to recover the emails from my backups, or other.

Thanks in advance for any assistance.

Lew Siegel

Mam na nim 5 różnych kont, wszystko działało perfekcyjnie dopiero od 2 - 3 tygodni tak się dzieje i jest to bardzo uciążliwe. Jedyne co zrobiłem, to ze względu na dużą liczbę wiadomości na jednym z kont utworzyłem kopię wysłanych wiadomości w folderze lokalnym (wiadomości do 2023 roku do grudnia) nic więcej nie zmieniałem. title: Non compare più il testo de messaggio
content: Buongiorno, uso da moltissimi anni thunderbird come client di posta dove scarico diversi account... Ma da alcuni giorni mi sono accorta di un problema con uno degli account. Ho già cercato nel forum, ma non ho trovato risposte al mio problema. Uso un sistema windows 10 64-bit. Versione di thunderbird aggiornata 128.1.1esr. In pratica quando vado a visualizzare (cercare) tra la posta in arrivo, per cercare delle mail precedenti ma importanti, mi sono ritrovata a non visualizzare più il testo della mail, ossia compare tutto bianco anche se nell'elenco compare sia mittente e oggetto mail, ma quando mi sposto ed evidenzio la mail (classica barretta blu per la selezione) ecco che non compare più nulla, visualizza nell'anteprima ancora mittente ed oggetto dell'ultima mail che avevo selezionato (e che riesco a vedere il testo) e basta. Se provo ad aprire il messaggio in una nuova finestra zero assoluto tutto bianco (come messo nell'immagine). Questo succede per mail ricevuto in un arco di tempo anche dell'ultimo anno, poi ad un certo ponto mail precedenti riesco a leggerle e quelle recenti degli ultimi due giorni anche. Ho necessità di recuperare le mail perchè erano davvero importanti. Altra cosa, non riesco a visualizzare neppure mail che fanno parte di una stessa discussione come da foto due. Qualche settimana fa le diverse cartelle erano state compattate ma funzionava tutto. Grazie del supporto, spero abbiate soluzioni

For several years now, I have been unable to wipe out unwanted/spam messages ('dead letters') from the main inbox, surname@mydomain.com (using shift-delete then Yes/enter). Thunderbird just strikes them through, but leaves then in the inbox. As a 'temporary fix' to clear my inbox of dead letters, I have just been moving such 'dead letters' into a local 'junk' folder, which now has more than 10K dead letters. Similarly, I can't wipe them from the local 'junk' folder. How can this be fixed, please?

But this still works fine on the second address, forename.surname@mydomain.com. However, unfortunately, a new problem has appeared today on this additional inbox, where I routinely keep all non-trivial messages as a record spanning many years. The entire inbox has been emptied, apart from one new email that arrived today! Help!

All windows updates are installed properly. After updating yesterday to Nebula 130.b03 I can no longer send emails directly from Windows desktop explorer using the send to email recipient right click function (it does nothing) or from within an Office app (Excel and Powerpoint say there is a problem with the mail client and to restart the mail client, (which I have done multiple times). From within the app, I can send and receive emails with no problems, on my different accounts, but this lack of functionality is really aggravating. I would love to be able to rollback to 128, (not sure how to do so or if it's possible, and also if it wouldn't automatically update me back to 130)... or would also have to wait and see if the next update whenever that is fixes the problem.

title: Quick filter on 128.1.1esr (64-bit) on macOS Sonoma 14.6.1
content:
Thunderbird user since 2004, occasional (but should do more often this has reminded me!) donor; still believe it's the best mail client.

As of this week after updates, I have a problem with Quick Filter which I use extensively to navigate and manage my mail.

I have large IMAP folders. I've done common sense compacting etc but they remain necessarily large. While they're large, they're in no meaningful way larger than they have been for the last decade. It's not the IMAP folders that have changed!

But as of the last week when I use Quick Filter:

1/ pressing enter (which I do by habit) attempts to open a "tab" with the results. a/ this causes my system to crash and b/ pressing enter didn't do this previously, it just ran the filter without opening a tab for results.

2/ if I don't press enter, the filter runs but *usually* (not always) crashes

I force quit and go again.

As it stands, locating mails in the way I have for almost 20 years doesn't work ...

This is all since Nebula!

Should I downgrade or is this an issue that's recognised/planned for fix?

I am running a good spec MacBook (96GB RAM, M3 Max, decent SSD) and had no problems until this week.

I see the line in the lower right working. Then it times out. My inbox screen halts 3/4 the way down not at the last e-mail. That has happened each time this has happened. All the things on line don't work. Reinstalling, Stop Norton, troubleshoot, clear cache. It seams that my password was changed or something like that. My phone, my other computers all still work. The last time it fixed itself I tried to put Mailbird on my computer. When Mailbird asked for info from Thunderbird to work. Thunderbird sent over incorrect log in info. I corrected it and then Mailbird and Thunderbird then worked. There must be a fix that Mozilla can help me with. Thanks.
creator: rudyard1

title: Database messages corrupted? Headers of some messages, and chunks of other messages mixed.
content:
Hi everyone,

I've been experiencing weird troubles with some messages. When I click a message in the list to open it, sometimes the message opened shows parts of other unrelated messages, including incomplete content, lines of base64 encoded strings, boundary lines, partial html code, you name it. Looks like sometimes the program just mixes valid headers with parts of other random messages, starting on random lines. Sometimes the message content shows only the final line of the code of another unrelated message (the boundary end).

I'm attaching two captures to illustrate the issue. Only one folder is affected (well, unluckily for me, is the INBOX...), so I guess that file is the one broken.

I've tried the "repair" option on the affected folder, to no avail. Sometimes looks like the problem is gone, but then another message that was ok before shows up broken.

Thunderbird version is 128.1.0esr (64bits), running on Windows 11 Professional (23H2). Profile size is 30 GB, INBOX database file is 16.757.000 KB by now, with 17.445 messages. I'm using IMAP as server, and no message is broken on the server (I've checked them on the webmail service). The machine is using a SSD, NVMe kingston RBUSNS8 239GB, if you want to know... It's ok AFAIK. 

 If you need any other information regarding this, please ask and I will gladly provide it. As you may imagine, this issue is driving me mad!       Thank you for any kind of help you can provide to fix this weird issue.
creator: gcastrop

title: Yahoo email stopped working with Thunderbird August 28, 2024 - OAuth2 has been enabled forever - can't log in
content:
All of a sudden I cannot access yahoo mail via Thunderbird. I keep getting prompted for my email id and password, but that doesn't help.

This started August 28, 2024. OAuth2 has been enabled forever.

On the Yahoo help page, there is mention of an "app password" for third-party access. https://help.yahoo.com/kb/account/learn-generate-password-sln15241.html

Has anybody done this? What exactly does it mean? Do I substitute this generated password in the Thunderbird account settings for my real password?
